name: SONAX Klebstoffrest-Entferner – Extrem entzndbares Lösemittel-Aerosol
hazard_category: Extremely flammable aerosol category 1; pressurized container; causes severe eye irritation; may cause drowsiness/dizziness; forms explosive vapour-air mixtures
hazards_description: Classified as Aerosol 1 – extremely flammable aerosol (H222) and pressurized container that may burst when heated (H229, H280). Causes severe eye irritation (H319) and may cause drowsiness and dizziness (STOT SE 3, H336).[attached_file:file:15] Composition: 50–75% 1-Methoxy-2-propanol (CAS 107-98-2, Flam. Liq. 3 H226, STOT SE 3 H336, LD50 oral 4016 mg/kg, dermal 2000 mg/kg); 25–50% 2-Propanol (CAS 67-63-0, Flam. Liq. 2 H225, Eye Irrit. 2 H319, STOT SE 3 H336, LD50 oral 5840 mg/kg, dermal 13900 mg/kg, LC50 inhal. 25 mg/L); 5–10% n-Butan (CAS 106-97-8, Flam. Gas 1A H220, Press. Gas H280); 5–10% Propan (CAS 74-98-6, Flam. Gas 1A H220, Press. Gas H280); 1–3% Isobutan (CAS 75-28-5, Flam. Gas 1A H220, Press. Gas H280); 5–15% aliphatic hydrocarbons.[attached_file:file:15] Flammable liquid and vapours form explosive mixtures with air; 85 wt% flammable constituents, combustion heat ≥30 kJ/g.
protective_measures: Use only in well-ventilated areas or outdoors. Ensure adequate workplace ventilation (local exhaust ventilation can be achieved through ventilation or general exhaust). Avoid inhalation of aerosol and contact with eyes and skin. Do not eat, drink, or smoke during handling. Wash hands thoroughly before breaks and after work. Wear safety goggles (EN 166), protective clothing (appropriate for solvent contact), and if necessary respiratory protection (Type A filter for organic vapours/gases, EN 14387) when workplace limit is exceeded.[attached_file:file:15] Do not pierce or burn the container, even after use. Keep away from heat, hot surfaces, sparks, open flames, and ignition sources; storage temperature must not exceed 50 °C. Store in a cool, well-ventilated location in tightly sealed containers away from incompatible materials (strong oxidizing agents, strong acids). Storage classification TRGS 510: Class 2B (pressurized containers).[attached_file:file:15]
emergency_procedures: For accidental release: Ensure adequate ventilation; eliminate all ignition sources. Do not allow open flames or smoking. Contain spillage with absorbent material (sand, diatomaceous earth, acid binder, universal binder, sawdust), collect in suitable containers, and dispose as hazardous waste. Prevent entry into drains, groundwater, or surface waters; notify authorities if contamination occurs.[attached_file:file:15] For fire: Use alcohol-resistant foam, CO₂, dry powder, or water mist (avoid full water jet). Wear complete protective suit and self-contained breathing apparatus. Cool exposed containers with water spray. Collect contaminated firefighting water separately. Hazards: Carbon monoxide and carbon dioxide; explosive gas-air mixtures form during use.[attached_file:file:15]
emergency_phone_reference: Germany: +49 (0)89 19240 (Giftnotruf München); Austria: +43 1 406 43 43 (VIZ); Switzerland: +41 44 251 51 51 (Tox Info Suisse); Belgium: +32 070 245 245 (Antigiftzentrum); Luxembourg: +352 8002-5500 (Antigiftzentrum Belgien).[attached_file:file:15]

first_aid.inhalation: Move affected person to fresh air and lay down. For airway irritation, dizziness, nausea, or loss of consciousness, seek immediate medical attention. If unconscious, place in stable lateral position and transport with medical assistance.[attached_file:file:15]
first_aid.skin_contact: Generally, the product is not skin-irritating. Wash affected areas with water and mild soap. Remove contaminated clothing immediately.[attached_file:file:15]
first_aid.eye_contact: Rinse eyes with running water for several minutes with eyelids held open. Remove contact lenses if possible and continue rinsing. Consult a physician immediately.[attached_file:file:15]
first_aid.ingestion: Rinse mouth and drink plenty of water. Do NOT induce vomiting. Seek immediate medical attention/poison control.[attached_file:file:15]

first_aider_reference: Symptoms include headache, dizziness, fatigue, nausea, and eye irritation. If any symptoms persist or are suspected, seek medical advice. Provide safety data sheet to treating physician. Consider occupational exposure limits: 1-Methoxy-2-propanol AGW (Germany) 370 mg/m³ (100 ppm), 2-Propanol AGW 500 mg/m³ (200 ppm). Symptomatic treatment; treat based on patient condition assessment.[attached_file:file:15]
fire_suppression: Suitable extinguishing agents: alcohol-resistant foam, CO₂, dry powder, water mist. Unsuitable: full water jet. Wear complete protective suit and self-contained breathing apparatus. Cool containers in danger area with water spray. Collect contaminated firefighting water separately; do not allow to enter drains.[attached_file:file:15]
disposal: Dispose in accordance with local, regional, national, and international regulations. Classified as hazardous waste (Directive 2008/98/EC, Annex III). Waste code: 15 01 10 (contaminated packaging containing residues of hazardous substances; HP3 – flammable; HP4 – irritant causing eye damage; HP5 – STOT/aspiration hazard). Completely emptied containers may be recycled if clean; non-cleanable packaging must be disposed of as hazardous waste.[attached_file:file:15]
transport_classification: UN 1950 (Pressurized gas containers), Class 2.1 (flammable gas), Classification code 5F, Hazard label 2.1. Limited Quantity 1 L, Exempt Quantity E2, Transport Category 2, Tunnel restriction code D (Germany). Marine pollutant: No.[attached_file:file:15]
environmental_hazard: 1-Methoxy-2-propanol: Fish toxicity LC50 96h 6800 mg/L (Leuciscus idus); Daphnia LC50 48h 23300 mg/L; algae EC50 1000 mg/L; readily biodegradable (90–100%, OECD 301E); log Kow 0.43 (low bioaccumulation).[attached_file:file:15] 2-Propanol: Fish toxicity LC50 96h 9640 mg/L; Daphnia LC50 24h 9714 mg/L; readily biodegradable (53 d); slightly hazardous to aquatic organisms. No PBT/vPvB substances ≥0.1%. WGK 1 (weakly hazardous to water). VOC content: 100%.[attached_file:file:15]
